alternative_parents.description: Steroids carrying a hydroxyl group at the 3-position of the steroid backbone.
alternative_parents.name: 3-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: Steroids carrying a hydroxyl group at the 17-position of the steroid backbone.
alternative_parents.name: 17-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: Hydroxysteroids carrying a alpha-hydroxyl group at the 16-position.
alternative_parents.name: 16-alpha-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic compounds containing a phenanthrene moiety, which is a tricyclic aromatic compound with three non-linearly fused benzene.
alternative_parents.name: Phenanthrenes and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a tetralin moiety, which consists of a benzene fused to a cyclohexane.
alternative_parents.name: Tetralins

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that a unsubstituted at the 2-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-2-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aliphatic ring substituted with at least one hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclic alcohols and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Polyols containing an alcohol group at two adjacent positions.
alternative_parents.name: 1,2-diols

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Compounds based on the cyclopenta[a]phenanthrene carbon skeleton, partially or completely hydrogenated; there are usually methyl groups at C-10 and C-13, and often an alkyl group at C-17. By extension, one or more bond scissions, ring expansions and/or ring contractions of the skeleton may have occurred.
class.name: Steroids and steroid derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as estrogens and derivatives. These are steroids with a structure containing a 3-hydroxylated estrane.

direct_parent.description: Steroids with a structure containing a 3-hydroxylated estrane.
direct_parent.name: Estrogens and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Steroids with a structure based on the estrane skeleton.
subclass.name: Estrane steroids

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
